issue.title: FW: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
I really do, thanks for reminder!!!

**From:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 31, 2022 11:40 AM  
**To:** Mejia, Glen  <[MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Glen, 

I wanted to reachout to see if you still wanted to chat about GPS devices. I’m around most of the week. 

Jesse 

**From:** Mejia, Glen  <[MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 19, 2022 4:19 PM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant) <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hello Jesse,

I’m stepping in here to see if I can help our group with testing some GPS options. I’m the new biology lead for NWR and just getting up to speed on our gear. I’ve worked with an R1 before, and it was pretty straightforward, but did have trouble sometimes syncing with the tablet or phone and know they can be finnicky. Let setup a meeting to chat before we start field testing equipment.

Cheers,

Glen Mejia

NWR Biology Lead

WSDOT Northwest Region

Mobile: 503-962-9007

Email: [MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 18, 2022 9:21 PM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:AltonJe@WSDOT.WA.GOV)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:SavageS@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:MerriSA@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Jesse!

I’m sorry but I don’t know what a “use case” means!

Sam – would it be helpful to give the R1 or R2 a spin on an upcoming field visit? Accuracy is a good question. Likely not “survey grade.”

You all are super helpful, and have great questions, and I think I’m going to ask for some help in sorting out our program needs, it’s something we need a few people to weigh in on. I’ll follow up shortly…

Thanks!  
Ruth

**From:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 18, 2022 4:08 PM  
**To:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Ruth, 

Before I get too far into the weed, what you’re use case? 

Yes! We can check out equipment to the Regions. However, our HQ ESO folks do have first priority. 

I have an R2 and R1 for you to demo if you’re interested. These units are both sub-foot. Do you need survey-grade(cm) accuracy? We can talk offline if that’s the case. 

As for software – you’ll want to use ArcGIS Collector or ArcGIS FieldMaps (usually on a WSDOT iPad). This requires as WSDOT AGOL account. You can use work and personal phones with these apps. 

It’s a good solution is you plan to manage and view data in ArcMap. 

We also offer Trimble TerraSync on a ToughPad for offline workflows. However – this requires additional post processing on my end. 

We do have a few older Trimble Geo6000s and a Geo7 with TerraSync SW and ArcPad. These are handheld devices. 

Feel free to give me a call this week if you what to discuss what the best software and hardware option would be for your program. 

Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 1:44 PM  
**To:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** Re: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

This is super helpful. Thanks a bunch, Steve. 

Jesse, is checking equipment out still an option? I think that might be a tad cumbersome for our needs. But I know we have to have equipment care and feeding folks otherwise. 

Sam/Steve, what do you see the benefit as making this investment would provide? No need for the survey crew to pick up our points? Anything else?

Thanks!

Ruth

Get [Outlook for iOS](https://aka.ms/o0ukef)

* * *

**From:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 1:25 PM  
**To:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Ruth – 

Addressing the toughbooks first, I would say they are not really optimized for the type of work we would do in the field. They would act more like a desktop solution and there aren’t really any commercial-off-the-shelf solutions that would work well for the investment we’d need to put into them. The fieldwork we would do really is optimized for tablets or phones that run an iOS or Android operating system, so an iPad/iPhone/Android phone/Android tablet really would be the optimal solution for our workflow.

There are a couple of options that can pair with an iOS or Android device being used for Field Maps GIS fieldwork:

  * Beacon on a belt/palm sized Bluetooth GNSS


    * Trimble R1 ~ $3,000
    * EOS Arrow 100 ~ $3,000
    * iSXBlue II ~ $2,900


  * Traditional GPS antenna Bluetooth GNSS (would need secondary purchase of at least a pole/field staff to screw antenna onto)


    * Trimble R2 ~ $3,300


      * Accessory pole ~ $150



There is a need for an App on each device (meaning admin password if WSDOT device, no issue with own device) to pair with the GNSS device and that will in turn be useable by the Field Maps GIS app in the field. 

One note worth mentioning, when my GIS team was supporting more regular fieldwork on the 405 megaprogram, we worked with Jesse Alton ([altonje@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:altonje@wsdot.wa.gov)) at WSDOT to check-out and use existing WSDOT-owned Trimble R1 or R2 devices from HQ (I believe) with all of the cables to charge and properly setup the devices. Jesse may not be the exact right person, but as WSDOT owns these devices already, investigating the use of them with Jesse may be better before purchase. Not sure Jesse sits in the same team, I last worked with Jesse 2 years ago, but Jesse should have the info we need or the person to contact to work this out. 

I have cc’ed Jesse here. Thank you Ruth.

  
Steve

****

**Steve Savage**

I-405/SR 167 Environmental Team

425.450.2717 | [savages@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:savages@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 10:55 AM  
**To:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: ESO tablet transfer to NWR biologists - INC000000882550

Hey Steve and Sam,

I’m hoping you all can help with a little research on GPS antennae recommendations + costs.

It sounds like folks are mostly using their phones to collect data, but Sam mentioned an antennae could be helpful. Do you know what sort of antennae would work? And the cost? Does it work on android and apple?

Also we have Panasonic toughpads in our inventory, see chain below. Folks haven’t found them to be very useful, and they also aren’t GPS connected. Are you familiar with these devices, Steve? Can we add an antennae? Would it be different than what we’d need for the phone?

Thanks!!

Ruth

issue.title: FW: R2 Quote Upgrade
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Purchase Quote->>

Jesse,

We can certainly do the no cost license transfer for “TerraSync -> TerraFlex” and “Pathfinder to Trimble Positions” if you have your licenses current and at the latest software version. The TerraFlex cloud/direct workflow is fully compatible with iOS and Android workflow at this stage, you will be able to post process your data on your PC (Windows 11) with no problem.

The Trimble DA2 workflow is fully supported by iOS, personally have been using this combo over an year and it has not failed me. Very similar to the R2, the DA2 uses real time configuration, compatible with TerraFlex cloud/direct workflow. However, the DA2 workflow is attached to a subscription workflow which could be a little bit annoying to manage if you have a large amount of users, and you don’t have to use WSRN with this workflow. In terms of accuracy, it outstands all other mapping grade equipment when you work under heavy canopies, this includes the Geo7x workflow.

I also attached a quote on the R2 centimeter upgrade in this email, state contract discount applied. Feel free to let me know if you have any questions!

Thank you,

**Subject:** RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Trimble Supported Workflows - WSDOT 

Hey Sara, 

Just for the record, I do have two R2s (one CM) and Trimble Positions for ArcGISDesktop. 

I’m interested in the TerraSync > TerraFlex “no cost trade in”. 

I’ll have to continue to use PFO and TerraSync for the next few years, but wanted to slowly move some my TerraSync licenses to TerraFlex and TerraOffice for future workflows with our R2 units. Just thinking about my option moving off TerraSync. My only issue is that TerraFlex and TerraOffice have to work on IOS and possible WINDOWS11. 

Also – I’d like to maybe upgrade my decimeter R2 to CM. Can you send me a quote for that?? 

Also – Any info on the DA2 Catalyst system for IOS. 

Cheers, 

Jesse 

Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Sara Lau  <[sara@frontierprecision.com](mailto:sara@frontierprecision.com)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 3, 2022 7:42 AM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** [EXTERNAL] RE: Trimble Supported Workflows - WSDOT 

**WARNING:** This email originated from outside of WSDOT. Please use caution with links and attachments. 

Hi Jesse,

The TerraFlex Direct and TerraFlex cloud workflows are designed for the newer GNSS devices, this includes the TDC650 and the Trimble DA2 and R2. Both equipment uses real time configuration but you can also post process your real time data if they are not very ideal in the field. The TerraFlex Direct workflow is required to have a TerraFlex subscription and a Trimble Positions license. We can convert your Pathfinder Office license to Trimble Position with zero cost if your Pathfinder license is current at v5.9. 

Moving forward with these two workflows will require newer equipment than just the Geo7x, I’m more than happy to get you more information on these modern GNSS devices, feel free to let me know if you have any questions!

Thank you,

issue.body:
*Sent by Google Scholar Alerts (scholaralerts-noreply@google.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---

issue.title: No DCC
issue.body:
*Sent by Nick Mallalieu (nick.mallalieu@btinternet.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi, I have just built an EX-Command station using a genuine Arduino UNO and genuine Arduino Motor Shield.  I have a 12V 5 amp power supply to the shield and am powering the UNO via the laptop computer which is running Windows 11 and  an Edge browser.

I am not getting DCC power from either the A or B connection although if I run command <1> on the Arduino Serial Monitor window all 4 lights come on and the voltage checks out at 12.5 AC on the A outputs.  As soon as I reset the Motor Board and the lights are not on there is no power again from output A.

I have checked Baud rate is 115200 and have set both CR & NL.

EX-Installer runs OK once I allowed the Firewall to let it!

I have been using the “TRY IT” EX-WebThrottle via the USB and that is configured as per the instructions.

I am a bit stumped can you please help?

Nick

issue.title: Sponsored Post
issue.body:
*Sent by Martin (martin@contentmar.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi,

I hope this email finds you well.

I am sending this email to ask if you are interested in sponsored posts.We are searching for relevant sites and blogs for our clients.

You will get 100% top notch content with 1 do follow link relevant to your site niche.

Please let me know how much do you charge per post?

We will pay you through Paypal or Payoneer gateway as soon our article is published.

Looking forward to building long-term business opportunities with you.

Best Regards,
Martin

issue.title: RFQ - The Insights Shop - HIV Tracking Study (P. Goldfinger) - Netherlands
issue.body:
*Sent by  (thomas@tis-research.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi There,

I hope you are well!

We are from The Insights Shop (TIS) and we have a new HIV Tracking Study for Netherlands market with below details:

Market: Netherlands

TOTAL N= 10 HIV Specialists to complete: 

  * _Online pre work task ahead of the Web-based telephone interviews_



 _20 minute survey – TIS to provide links_

  *  _Web-based telephone interviews (TDIs)_



 _45 minute interviews_

Once we have approval recruitment and fieldwork can run simultaneously. We aim to complete all interviews within a 6 week period – we expect we would have approval to start towards the end of October.

Kindly let us know your feasibility & CPI for this study at earliest. 

Looking forward to hearing back from you

Thanking you,

 ** _Thomas Raymond_**

 _Project Manager_

 _![Banner](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/849481ec-391a-405e-95a7-152145854fd4/image001-14.png)_ __

 ** _The Insights Shop |_**[ ** _www.theinsightsshop.com_**](http://www.theinsightsshop.com/) ** __**

 _743 Audley RD South Ajax ON L1Z 0T7, Canada_

 ** _Office:_** ** __**_+1 (302) 497- 4476_

 ** _Email:_** __[_thomas.raymond@theinsightsshop.com_](mailto:thomas.raymond@theinsightsshop.com) _ ___

 _The content of this email is confidential and intended for the recipient specified in message only. It is strictly forbidden to share any part of this message with any third party, without a written consent of the sender. If you received this message by mistake, please reply to this message and follow with its deletion, so that we can ensure such a mistake does not occur in the future._

issue.title: Updated October salary review (Final Post-Covid-19 listing)
issue.body:
*Sent by Finance Dept ™® (info@diliti.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
---  
| 

Your wages monthly activity statement

Dear support,

Enclosed year's Wage increment will start in October of 2022 and will be paid out for the first time by November, with recalculation as of October.. 

To view documents in , you must have Adobe Acrobat PDF reader software version 4 or above installed on your computer.

If your computer does not have Adobe PDF reader, visit the Adobe website to download and install the latest PDF reader.

  
  


Customer Care

  
|   
| 

Please do not respond to this email

This email was sent to support@europe-geology.eu by europe-geology.eu. If received in error, please email us at support@europe-geology.eu and delete this message. You may not disclose, copy or use this email if you are not the intended recipient.

To unsubscribe from this message, please login to europe-geology.eu and navigate to the notifications tab to change your settings

|

The dichotomy in deep-sea biodiversity research consisting of a gap between the   
sheer scale of the deep sea and our incomplete knowledge of what actually lives   
there, is immense; areas away from the shelf edge making up the deep sea cover …

issue.title: Package GIS layers to share with consultants
issue.body:
*Sent by @kechinn (chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Coordinate with Declan Weingart and Victoria Book.

~Keisha

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 1:02 PM  
**To:** Chinn, Keisha  <chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** FW: GIS Task

Hey Keisha,

I am trying to develop a GIS file to share with consultants, and I was wondering if you could help me get a GIS file package that would work well for that?

Thanks,

Declan Weingart

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 12:57 PM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Thanks Declan. 

Thinking it would be good to have the GIS files to share with the team. 

Can you ask Keisha Chin to help you get a GIS file package that we can send to the consultants. 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 12:05 PM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

I have attached the map with the ariel imagery. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 10:31 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Great. 

Can you turn on the ariel photo so we can see where they are in relation to land marks. 

The mitigation site is the blue hatch? And the conservation area the green? 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 10:03 AM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Yeah, I just need to zoom in more. I found an environmental Mitigation Site and attached a screenshot of the details as well as a resource conservation area. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 9:51 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

What are the blue dots within the right of way?? 

You should be able to click on that and get details. Might need to zoom in and change the color or line size.

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/36dc8312-c0c1-4db8-8271-75035a29cfb5/image001.png)

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 9:38 AM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

I made sure all the layers I could find relating to Banks and mitigation sites where turned on as well as the resource conservation areas. I have attached a picture of the exported map. 

I didn’t see much mitigation sites close to the project area or resource conservation areas. 

Let me know if you want something different!

Thanks,

Declan

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 27, 2022 7:50 AM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

Can you export the map and send it to me. 

Check wetland mitigation sites (in addition to banks) – I think there should be a layer for that!

Also, resource conservation areas. 

Thanks! 

**From:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 26, 2022 2:59 PM  
**To:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GIS Task

The closest wetland mitigation site is the Chehalis Basin Wetland Mitigation Bank. I didn’t see any resource conservation areas nearby. I have attached the arc GIS map I used to look this up. 

<https://ecology.wa.gov/Water-Shorelines/Wetlands/Mitigation/Wetland-mitigation-banking/Mitigation-bank-projects/Chehalis-Basin>

Let me know if you want me to look up more information. 

**From:** Book, Victoria  <[BookV@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BookV@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 26, 2022 2:04 PM  
**To:** Weingart, Declan  <[WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WeingaD@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** GIS Task

Declan, 

Do you have access to GIS? 

If yes, can you look up Resource conservation area and wetland mitigation sites in the Nisqually Delta Area of I-5. This general area. 

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/36dc8312-c0c1-4db8-8271-75035a29cfb5/image002.png)

_Victoria Book_ _(she/her)_

Assistant Olympic Region Environmental Manager __

Telework phone / mobile (360) 870 – 8446

[victoria.book@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:victoria.book@wsdot.wa.gov)

~~Office (360) 570 – 6707~~

issue.title: Ticket Submitted via Website
issue.body:
*Sent by  (dccextended@gmail.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
## Tommy created a ticket 

Name: Tommy Jardenbæk

Email: tja@jardenbaekit.dk

Timezone: 1

Software: EX-CommandStation

Version: 4.0.x

Title: 10Amp Motor Driver shield with built-in 5V buck regulator and no additional heatsink

Description: Building a LGB / Bachmann Garden Railroad I have been looking for Motor Driver Shields with more than 2Amps. I found this from Cytron Technologies. Bought it from Elektor.com in Holland. I think this may be of interest regards various Voltages and the built-in buck regulatores. I have attached the Datasheet on the shield. But I also have a consern about the current sense, as described on your pages. Can You tell me if this Motor Driver Shield is ok to use.

issue.title: FW: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing
issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Mejia, Glen  <MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, October 19, 2022 4:19 PM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov>; Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant) <MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Cc:** Park, Ruth E.  <ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** FW: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hello Jesse,

I’m stepping in here to see if I can help our group with testing some GPS options. I’m the new biology lead for NWR and just getting up to speed on our gear. I’ve worked with an R1 before, and it was pretty straightforward, but did have trouble sometimes syncing with the tablet or phone and know they can be finnicky. Let setup a meeting to chat before we start field testing equipment.

Cheers,

Glen Mejia

NWR Biology Lead

WSDOT Northwest Region

Mobile: 503-962-9007

Email: [MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MejiaGA@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 18, 2022 9:21 PM  
**To:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:AltonJe@WSDOT.WA.GOV)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:SavageS@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV](mailto:MerriSA@Consultant.WSDOT.WA.GOV)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Jesse!

I’m sorry but I don’t know what a “use case” means!

Sam – would it be helpful to give the R1 or R2 a spin on an upcoming field visit? Accuracy is a good question. Likely not “survey grade.”

You all are super helpful, and have great questions, and I think I’m going to ask for some help in sorting out our program needs, it’s something we need a few people to weigh in on. I’ll follow up shortly…

Thanks!  
Ruth

**From:** Alton, Jesse  <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 18, 2022 4:08 PM  
**To:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Savage, Steve (Consultant) <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Hey Ruth, 

Before I get too far into the weed, what you’re use case? 

Yes! We can check out equipment to the Regions. However, our HQ ESO folks do have first priority. 

I have an R2 and R1 for you to demo if you’re interested. These units are both sub-foot. Do you need survey-grade(cm) accuracy? We can talk offline if that’s the case. 

As for software – you’ll want to use ArcGIS Collector or ArcGIS FieldMaps (usually on a WSDOT iPad). This requires as WSDOT AGOL account. You can use work and personal phones with these apps. 

It’s a good solution is you plan to manage and view data in ArcMap. 

We also offer Trimble TerraSync on a ToughPad for offline workflows. However – this requires additional post processing on my end. 

We do have a few older Trimble Geo6000s and a Geo7 with TerraSync SW and ArcPad. These are handheld devices. 

Feel free to give me a call this week if you what to discuss what the best software and hardware option would be for your program. 

Jesse Alton

GIS & Data Project Manager 

Environmental Information Program 

**WSDOT - Environmental Services Office**

C: 360-480-9356

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 1:44 PM  
**To:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** Re: GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

This is super helpful. Thanks a bunch, Steve. 

Jesse, is checking equipment out still an option? I think that might be a tad cumbersome for our needs. But I know we have to have equipment care and feeding folks otherwise. 

Sam/Steve, what do you see the benefit as making this investment would provide? No need for the survey crew to pick up our points? Anything else?

Thanks!

Ruth

Get [Outlook for iOS](https://aka.ms/o0ukef)

* * *

**From:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 1:25 PM  
**To:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** GNSS/GPS Antennae recommendations - Field computing

Ruth – 

Addressing the toughbooks first, I would say they are not really optimized for the type of work we would do in the field. They would act more like a desktop solution and there aren’t really any commercial-off-the-shelf solutions that would work well for the investment we’d need to put into them. The fieldwork we would do really is optimized for tablets or phones that run an iOS or Android operating system, so an iPad/iPhone/Android phone/Android tablet really would be the optimal solution for our workflow.

There are a couple of options that can pair with an iOS or Android device being used for Field Maps GIS fieldwork:

  * Beacon on a belt/palm sized Bluetooth GNSS


    * Trimble R1 ~ $3,000
    * EOS Arrow 100 ~ $3,000
    * iSXBlue II ~ $2,900


  * Traditional GPS antenna Bluetooth GNSS (would need secondary purchase of at least a pole/field staff to screw antenna onto)


    * Trimble R2 ~ $3,300


      * Accessory pole ~ $150



There is a need for an App on each device (meaning admin password if WSDOT device, no issue with own device) to pair with the GNSS device and that will in turn be useable by the Field Maps GIS app in the field. 

One note worth mentioning, when my GIS team was supporting more regular fieldwork on the 405 megaprogram, we worked with Jesse Alton ([altonje@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:altonje@wsdot.wa.gov)) at WSDOT to check-out and use existing WSDOT-owned Trimble R1 or R2 devices from HQ (I believe) with all of the cables to charge and properly setup the devices. Jesse may not be the exact right person, but as WSDOT owns these devices already, investigating the use of them with Jesse may be better before purchase. Not sure Jesse sits in the same team, I last worked with Jesse 2 years ago, but Jesse should have the info we need or the person to contact to work this out. 

I have cc’ed Jesse here. Thank you Ruth.

  
Steve

****

**Steve Savage**

I-405/SR 167 Environmental Team

425.450.2717 | [savages@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:savages@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Park, Ruth E.  <[ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:ParkRE@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Monday, October 17, 2022 10:55 AM  
**To:** Savage, Steve (Consultant)  <[SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:SavageS@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Merrick, Sam A. (Consultant)  <[MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:MerriSA@consultant.wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** FW: ESO tablet transfer to NWR biologists - INC000000882550

Hey Steve and Sam,

I’m hoping you all can help with a little research on GPS antennae recommendations + costs.

It sounds like folks are mostly using their phones to collect data, but Sam mentioned an antennae could be helpful. Do you know what sort of antennae would work? And the cost? Does it work on android and apple?

Also we have Panasonic toughpads in our inventory, see chain below. Folks haven’t found them to be very useful, and they also aren’t GPS connected. Are you familiar with these devices, Steve? Can we add an antennae? Would it be different than what we’d need for the phone?

Thanks!!

Ruth

issue.body:
*Sent by @jesse-WSDOT (AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
**From:** Ward, Carl  <WardC@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Thursday, October 20, 2022 11:48 AM  
**To:** Chinn, Keisha  <chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov>; Alton, Jesse <AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** FEMA GIS information display problem

I was reviewing a project (US 101, MP 211.55 to 211.61, Sol Duc Bridge) and checked the GIS floodplain mapping.

The only workbench FEMA layer that displayed correctly is the “FEMA Q3 County (older)” – around the bridge is a FEMA zone A. This is consistent with the FIRM panel (copy attached with arrow at project location).

The “National Flood Hazard Layers (NFHL) – Current” shows nothing there.

The “FEMA Preliminary Floodplain Data” for Clallam County has labels, but no boundaries or shading. The County online mapping shows the zone A.

[https://websrv31.clallamcountywa.gov/portal/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=bd3531a223c145bdb8e1883dcc0dd666&extent=-13820023.3042%2C6115645.3426%2C-13812752.2319%2C6118865.2524%2C102100](https://websrv31.clallamcountywa.gov/portal/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=bd3531a223c145bdb8e1883dcc0dd666&extent=-13820023.3042%2C6115645.3426%2C-13812752.2319%2C6118865.2524%2C102100)

I haven’t seen this problem before on other sites and I didn’t check any other areas to see if this was a consistent problem. Also don’t know if it’s just me having a display problem.




---
*Attachments:*

1. [current_FIRM.pdf](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/0354eff3-9132-4041-8126-bb31f2b12f14/current_FIRM.pdf)

issue.title: Ticket Submitted via Website
issue.body:
*Sent by  (dccextended@gmail.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
## John created a ticket 

Name: John Moore

Email: johnfm3@hotmail.com

Timezone: -8

Software: EX-CommandStation

Version: 4.0.x

Title: Optional configurations

Description: I am building a DCC train layout for my son and want to use a dual track DC controller case with Knobs and a direction switch. !) Are there options for a throttle Knob and a Direction Switch? Do you have a option to wire a throttle or 2 directly to the stack? Is it documented? 2) I would like the in case throttle's to have a dedicated DCC ID of 3 and 4. Think the same as a NCE Twin or the entry level DigiTraxx Zephyr. 3) I plan on using the program terminals on the powerboard, but would like to use external power boosters such as the DigiKiejs DR5033 for my main track power. Is this something which is possible and documented? These are the 3 requirements I need for my project. The easist solution would to be buy a NCE twin and install internals in my dual dc case. But this seems like a more flexible solution and something I would like to support. Thanks for the assistance in my investigation of my next dcc solution, John

 _Remaining email Quota: 100_

issue.title: Business Request!
issue.body:
*Sent by Mr Vincent Mann (office@oilegroup.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Dear Sir

I have sent you several emails since last week, I am resending this to you again for urgent attention. My client from your country Which I think is your relative, died as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic here on the 19th of January 2020 and left no clear beneficiary as Next of Kin except some vital documents related to the deposit still with me.

All efforts made by me to trace his Next of Kin proved abortive because he did not make any will prior to his death. Since then I have made several inquiries to locate family members of my late clients and this has proved unsuccessful. After several unsuccessful attempts to locate any member of his family, I decided to trace my client's last name through the internet. Luckily I discovered your email.

I am contacting you to assist in claiming the money left behind by my client before they get confiscated or declared unclaimed by the Bank where this huge deposit was deposited, Bank has given me the notice to provide the next of kin to claim the fund, Consequent upon this, my idea is that we can have a deal/agreement and I am going to do this legally with your name as the bonafide beneficiary of the amount in question as I have all legal document to back our claim, I seek your consent to present you as the next of kin/beneficiary of the funds/.

Kindly provide the following information so we can get to the next step.

1\. Full Name:

2\. Address:

3\. Age and Date of Birth:

4\. Occupation:

5\. Phone number:

6\. State of Origin Country:

The above required information will be used to prepare an application on your behalf as your Legal Counsel representing this claim legally. Upon your response, more details will be given to you such as the amount involve and the % you are getting for your efforts,

i wait for your reply

Regards,

Mr. Vincent Mann

10 GEORGE STREET, E14

Canary Wharf

London, UK

Email GIS Requests to: [wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:wsdotesogis@wsdot.wa.gov)

Email Drone Flight Requests to: [esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:esodronesupport@wsdot.wa.gov)

**From:** Chinn, Keisha  <chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 11, 2022 3:42 PM  
**To:** WSDOT ESO GIS  <WSDOTESOGIS@WSDOT.WA.GOV>  
**Subject:** FW: GIS Stormwater Heat Map and Prioritization

FYI

**From:** Bartoy, Kevin  <[BartoyK@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BartoyK@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Tuesday, October 11, 2022 2:24 PM  
**To:** Chinn, Keisha  <[chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Starks, Garrett <[StarksG@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:StarksG@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** Graham, Tyler  <[GrahaTy@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:GrahaTy@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Bush, Tony <[BushT@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:BushT@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** GIS Stormwater Heat Map and Prioritization

Good Afternoon Keisha and Garrett!

I was talking with Tony, who let me know that you all are doing some GIS work on stormwater, including heat maps for prioritization. Tyler Graham, our WSF GIS Analyst, cc’d here, has been doing some work for us around stormwater as well, and I’d like to hook him up with you all to discuss what you all are doing and to potentially get us hooked into it as well. We are in the process of trying to prioritize stormwater treatment at our facilities and would like to be in line with the larger agency. 

Tyler – Go forth and be awesome!

Thanks all!

K.

**Kevin M. Bartoy, LSS Green Belt, ENV SP**

Chief Sustainability Officer

[Office of Sustainability and Environmental Services](https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel/washington-state-ferries/about-us/environment)

[Washington State Ferries (WSF)](https://www.wsdot.wa.gov/ferries/)

issue.title: RFQ - The Insights Shop - HIV Tracking Study (P. Goldfinger) - Netherlands
issue.body:
*Sent by  (thomas@tis-research.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi There,

I hope you are well!

We are from The Insights Shop (TIS) and we have a new HIV Tracking Study for Netherlands market with below details:

Market: Netherlands

TOTAL N= 10 HIV Specialists to complete: 

  * _Online pre work task ahead of the Web-based telephone interviews_



 _20 minute survey – TIS to provide links_

  *  _Web-based telephone interviews (TDIs)_



 _45 minute interviews_

Upon commissioning we will share the materials (Screener, Discussion Guide, and Stimulus) that need to be translated

We will then need approval on the translation from our Internal Team before we can begin recruitment and fieldwork.

Once we have approval recruitment and fieldwork can run simultaneously. We aim to complete all interviews within a 6 week period – we expect we would have approval to start towards the end of October.

Moderator – please source a suitable Moderator for this project and share their CV/Bio. They will need to have _previous HIV experience_.

Adverse Events – our Internal Team has our own AE training materials which the Moderator will need to complete for this project

Kindly let us know your feasibility & CPI for this study at earliest. To sum up, we would need **Recruitment** , **Translations** , and **Moderator** costs from your end for this study

Looking forward to hearing back from you

Thanking you,

 ** _Thomas Raymond_**

 _Project Manager_

 _![Banner](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/a7b5d475-c45f-4ca0-aeea-ceb187bf9e4f/image001-22.png)_ __

If you received this message by mistake, please reply to this message and follow with its deletion, so that we can ensure such a mistake does not occur in the future._

issue.title: Business Request!
issue.body:
*Sent by Mr Vincent Mann (office@oilegroup.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Dear Sir

I have sent you several emails since last week, I am resending this to you again for urgent attention. My client from your country Which I think is your relative, died as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic here on the 19th of January 2020 and left no clear beneficiary as Next of Kin except some vital documents related to the deposit still with me.

All efforts made by me to trace his Next of Kin proved abortive because he did not make any will prior to his death. Since then I have made several inquiries to locate family members of my late clients and this has proved unsuccessful. After several unsuccessful attempts to locate any member of his family, I decided to trace my client's last name through the internet. Luckily I discovered your email.

I am contacting you to assist in claiming the money left behind by my client before they get confiscated or declared unclaimed by the Bank where this huge deposit was deposited, Bank has given me the notice to provide the next of kin to claim the fund, Consequent upon this, my idea is that we can have a deal/agreement and I am going to do this legally with your name as the bonafide beneficiary of the amount in question as I have all legal document to back our claim, I seek your consent to present you as the next of kin/beneficiary of the funds/.

Kindly provide the following information so we can get to the next step.

1\. Full Name:

2\. Address:

3\. Age and Date of Birth:

4\. Occupation:

5\. Phone number:

6\. State of Origin Country:

The above required information will be used to prepare an application on your behalf as your Legal Counsel representing this claim legally. Upon your response, more details will be given to you such as the amount involve and the % you are getting for your efforts,

i wait for your reply

Regards,

Mr. Vincent Mann

10 GEORGE STREET, E14

Canary Wharf

London, UK

issue.title: RFQ - The Insights Shop - HIV Tracking Study (P. Goldfinger) - Netherlands
issue.body:
*Sent by  (thomas.raymond@theinsightsshop.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Hi There,

I hope you are well!

We are from The Insights Shop (TIS) and we have a new HIV Tracking Study for Netherlands market with below details:

Market: Netherlands

TOTAL N= 10 HIV Specialists to complete: 

  * _Online pre work task ahead of the Web-based telephone interviews_



 _20 minute survey – TIS to provide links_

  *  _Web-based telephone interviews (TDIs)_



 _45 minute interviews_

Upon commissioning we will share the materials (Screener, Discussion Guide, and Stimulus) that need to be translated

We will then need approval on the translation from our Internal Team before we can begin recruitment and fieldwork.

Once we have approval recruitment and fieldwork can run simultaneously. We aim to complete all interviews within a 6 week period – we expect we would have approval to start towards the end of October.

Moderator – please source a suitable Moderator for this project and share their CV/Bio. They will need to have _previous HIV experience_.

Adverse Events – our Internal Team has our own AE training materials which the Moderator will need to complete for this project

Kindly let us know your feasibility & CPI for this study at earliest. To sum up, we would need **Recruitment** , **Translations** , and **Moderator** costs from your end for this study

Looking forward to hearing back from you

Thanking you,

 ** _Thomas Raymond_**

 _Project Manager_

issue.title: Business Request!
issue.body:
*Sent by Mr Vincent Mann (office@oilegroup.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Dear Sir

I have sent you several emails since last week, I am resending this to you again for urgent attention. My client from your country Which I think is your relative, died as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic here on the 19th of January 2020 and left no clear beneficiary as Next of Kin except some vital documents related to the deposit still with me.

All efforts made by me to trace his Next of Kin proved abortive because he did not make any will prior to his death. Since then I have made several inquiries to locate family members of my late clients and this has proved unsuccessful. After several unsuccessful attempts to locate any member of his family, I decided to trace my client's last name through the internet. Luckily I discovered your email.

I am contacting you to assist in claiming the money left behind by my client before they get confiscated or declared unclaimed by the Bank where this huge deposit was deposited, Bank has given me the notice to provide the next of kin to claim the fund, Consequent upon this, my idea is that we can have a deal/agreement and I am going to do this legally with your name as the bonafide beneficiary of the amount in question as I have all legal document to back our claim, I seek your consent to present you as the next of kin/beneficiary of the funds/.

Kindly provide the following information so we can get to the next step.

1\. Full Name:

2\. Address:

3\. Age and Date of Birth:

4\. Occupation:

5\. Phone number:

6\. State of Origin Country:

The above required information will be used to prepare an application on your behalf as your Legal Counsel representing this claim legally. Upon your response, more details will be given to you such as the amount involve and the % you are getting for your efforts,

i wait for your reply

Regards,

Mr. Vincent Mann

10 GEORGE STREET, E14

Canary Wharf

London, UK

issue.title: "ocean biodiversity information system" - new results
issue.body:
*Sent by Google Scholar Alerts (scholaralerts-noreply@google.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
### 

### [The European **Ocean Biodiversity Information System** (EurOBIS): your gateway to quality controlled marine biodiversity data](https://scholar.google.com/scholar_url?url=https://www.vliz.be/imisdocs/publications/381568.pdf&hl=en&sa=X&d=1535890561046500661&ei=Euw9Y-TFOon8mgGB8Z2ADw&scisig=AAGBfm2VwLUgfOtYyBpN8tR8fv66O3neDQ&oi=scholaralrt&hist=4xzX38sAAAAJ:8232670458149073384:AAGBfm3iKcoWDV_FfAZ9RQfeoyi3MmYP_A&html=&pos=0&folt=kw)

R Perez-Perez

Large scale marine biodiversity research is fundamental to ocean health. However,   
marine biodiversity data are often scattered and can be hard to find, access or   
integrate, turning holistic high-quality research into a challenge. The European …

issue.body:
*Sent by @kechinn (chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
**From:** Dreier, Jeff  <DreierJ@wsdot.wa.gov>

**Cc:** Norman, Mark  <NormanM@wsdot.wa.gov>; White, Kevin <WhiteK@wsdot.wa.gov>; Kapantais, Katina <KapantK@wsdot.wa.gov>  
**Subject:** FW: ESA/wildlife GIS data

Hi Keisha,

Please provide Kevin White access to sensitive fish and wildlife layers on the Workbench.

Thanks,

Jeff

**From:** Kapantais, Katina  <[KapantK@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:KapantK@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Saturday, October 1, 2022 12:29 PM  
**To:** Norman, Mark  <[NormanM@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:NormanM@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** White, Kevin  <[WhiteK@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WhiteK@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Dreier, Jeff <[DreierJ@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:DreierJ@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: ESA/wildlife GIS data

Hi Mark.

Jeff maintains the access list to our GIS Workbench and Programmatic databases. We are still in the process of migrating the bald eagle forms out of FileMaker Pro and into ECM so there is no accessible database for now. If either you or Kevin needs to fill out a bald eagle form, please let me know and I can send you a blank template to fill out and I’ll upload it soon as the ECM database is finished.

**From:** Norman, Mark  <[NormanM@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:NormanM@wsdot.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Friday, September 30, 2022 9:48 AM  
**To:** Kapantais, Katina  <[KapantK@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:KapantK@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Cc:** White, Kevin  <[WhiteK@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:WhiteK@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** ESA/wildlife GIS data

Hi Katina,

Who would I contact to get permissions for our new Bio, Kevin, for the sensitive wildlife/plants GIS data?

Cheers,

Mark

Mark Norman

SCR Biology and Mitigation Lead

[mark.norman@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:mark.norman@wsdot.wa.gov)

Cell: (509) 969-9005

issue.title: RE: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 1] Async buffer send/receive - call back preregistration
issue.body:
*Sent by Lopa Kundu (lkundu@nvidia.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Dear all,

Based on the discussions so far in this thread, I would like to echo Niall’s proposal to first agree upon the sequence call flows for Async and Sync Operations and then discuss about the details of callback registration process.

Proposal

Split the existing transport sequence call flow diagram in AAL Common API Spec. into following 6 sub-diagrams:  
  


Fig. 1 Flow diagrams for Sync mode Operation

  * Fig.1a. buffer Tx (with buffer retention)
  * Fig. 1b. buffer Tx (without buffer retention)
  * Fig. 1c. buffer Rx



Fig. 2 Flow diagrams for Async Operation

  * Fig. 2a. buffer Tx (with buffer retention)
  * Fig. 2b. buffer Tx (without buffer retention)
  * Fig. 2c. buffer Rx ****



Please let me know if you have any feedback on the above proposal.

I am planning to discuss this during the next AAL call (10/3).

If we agree with the above proposal, I can work with [ @Power, Niall](mailto:niall.power@intel.com) in drafting a corresponding CR.

Best Regards,

Lopa  
\------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**From:** Christopher Richards  <[christopher.richards@ericsson.com](mailto:christopher.richards@ericsson.com)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, September 7, 2022 8:57 AM  
**To:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org); Lopa Kundu <[lkundu@nvidia.com](mailto:lkundu@nvidia.com)>  
**Cc:** Timothy Carey (Consultant)  <[tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com)>; [niall.power@intel.com](mailto:niall.power@intel.com); Anh Thu Vo <[avo@marvell.com](mailto:avo@marvell.com)>  
**Subject:** RE: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 1] Async buffer send/receive - call back preregistration

Hi All,

Re-reading the Common API spec it states:

AAL implementation shall support both modes of operation. 

• • For synchronous mode, the AAL implementation, upon execution completion of sendBuffer operation, shall return the status of the sendBuffer operation 

• • For asynchronous mode, AAL implementation shall return the status of sendBuffer operation execution, only if Application preregisters for a callback; otherwise AAL implementation is not expected to return the execution status of the sendBuffer operation 

My example of using the async callback to indicate status of processing the buffers by the UP protocol stack are not valid. As per the spec, the returned status indicates the status of the API operation only, i.e. status of the buffer(s) getting sent to the accelerator device. It does not include an UP processing.

One possible use of Async sendBuffer() would be if the accelerator was separated from the application by a network, e.g. Ethernet. In this case it would be too long to wait on a sync call until some indication came back over the network that the accelerator revceived the buffer(s). 

Best Regards,

Chris

**From:** Power, Niall  <niall.power@intel.com>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, September 7, 2022 6:58 AM  
**To:** WG6@groups.o-ran.org; Lopa Kundu  <lkundu@nvidia.com>  
**Cc:** Timothy Carey (Consultant)  <tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com>; Anh Thu Vo <avo@marvell.com>  
**Subject:** RE: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 1] Async buffer send/receive - call back preregistration

**External email: Use caution opening links or attachments**  
  
---  
  
Hi Chris, 

Comments below. 

**From:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org) <[WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)> **On Behalf Of** Christopher Richards via groups.o-ran.org  
**Sent:** Wednesday, September 7, 2022 2:41 PM  
**To:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org); Lopa Kundu <[lkundu@nvidia.com](mailto:lkundu@nvidia.com)>  
**Cc:** Timothy Carey (Consultant)  <[tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com)>; Anh Thu Vo <[avo@marvell.com](mailto:avo@marvell.com)>  
**Subject:** Re: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 1] Async buffer send/receive - call back preregistration

Hi Niall,

Thanks for putting the two flow diagrams together.

For the async flow, should it include the aysnc callback step (from AAL à ORAN) after the note below step 10 and before step 11

**_[npower] Yes this is the open question. I agree for async there should be an option to have a call back setup._**

For your Q1: I would say that the callback would be for individual buffers. The bufferSend API is able to send multiple buffers in 1 API call but at the end of the day they are all individual buffers (with potentially different processing paths).

**_[npower] Yes Agree. Need to consider is a single call back with results for all buffers or multiple call backs_**

For Q2: The application has to be told (via callback) that the buffers can be freed otherwise would the application know that it’s safe to free or write to the buffer(s)?

**_[npower] Yes that is also my understanding but not sure if others agree_** ** _😊_**

Best Regards,

Chris

**From:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org) <[WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)> **On Behalf Of** Niall Power via groups.o-ran.org  
**Sent:** Wednesday, September 7, 2022 6:37 AM  
**To:** Lopa Kundu  <[lkundu@nvidia.com](mailto:lkundu@nvidia.com)>; [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)  
**Cc:** Timothy Carey (Consultant)  <[tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com)>; Christopher Richards <[christopher.richards@ericsson.com](mailto:christopher.richards@ericsson.com)>; Anh Thu Vo <[avo@marvell.com](mailto:avo@marvell.com)>  
**Subject:** Re: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 1] Async buffer send/receive - call back preregistration

Hi Lopa, 

I have tried to capture the two difference scenarios – async and sync for the send API. We can repeat for the receive API and other configurations later. 

My first question for the Async case is there a need for a step 11 to asynchronously return the status of the send operation and/or the individual buffers ? (my understanding was it was needed, but happy to discuss for high phy if it is not)

My second question is then around the buffer free (which is related to the ownership question). If there is no step 11 in the async case is it still valid for the application to free the buffers while the AAL could still be processing and sending the buffers ? 

Or should the AAL implementation free the buffer ?

We can update the below diagrams based on the discussions and include as a CR as I think separate flows will help explain the difference behaviours of the APIs. 

**Async** ****

| 

**Sync** ****  
  
---|---  
  
**![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/b2121f75-4d21-455f-8c2e-7c9c46673e6a/image001.png)******

| 

![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/b2121f75-4d21-455f-8c2e-7c9c46673e6a/image002.png)  
  
Best Regards,

Niall 

**From:** Lopa Kundu  <[lkundu@nvidia.com](mailto:lkundu@nvidia.com)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, September 7, 2022 4:35 AM  
**To:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)  
**Cc:** Timothy Carey (Consultant)  <[tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com)>; Christopher Richards <[christopher.richards@ericsson.com](mailto:christopher.richards@ericsson.com)>; Power, Niall <[niall.power@intel.com](mailto:niall.power@intel.com)>; Anh Thu Vo <[avo@marvell.com](mailto:avo@marvell.com)>  
**Subject:** [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 1] Async buffer send/receive - call back preregistration

Dear all,

This email thread is to trigger discussion on item 1.1.3 (FFS 3) in the [ AAL Common planned items table](https://oranalliance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/COWG/pages/2567405746/Nov+2022+Work+Item+Tracker#AAL-Common-API-Planned-Items) from O-RAN wiki.

_Topic_ : Details of callback registration mechanism for Async. Operation

I am including below some preliminary input from [ @Timothy Carey (Consultant)](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com), [ @Christopher Richards](mailto:christopher.richards@ericsson.com) and [ @niall.power@intel.com](mailto:niall.power@intel.com) on this topic stemmed from a small group discussion. 

Let us continue further discussion in this thread.

BR,

Lopa

\---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  * Feedback from Intel –


    * For Async transport APIs, callback register ‘ _per AAL profile Queue’_ may be sufficient. But the use cases (for Async. mode) are not clear.
    * Current AAL-C-App sequence diagram assume only Sync mode. We should clarify use cases and accordingly, update the App-flow before discussing API parameters.
    * What other use cases Aal-C-App API need to support? For example, should it support Async lookaside accelerator?



  * Feedback from QC –


    * Agree that associated flow diagram is needed. 
    * Need discussion on sendBuffer API potentially _without an AAL profile Queue_. 



    * Follow up on AAL-profile-queue (Intel)


    * Original intention of AAL-profile-queue was three-fold-


      * Group API level configurations – not used anymore based on previous discussions, current document has API configurations like synchronization mode as part of the API parameters not Queue Parameters
      * Provide Multi-threading support – _is this still a valid use case if people prefer to be able to send and receive without using an AAL Profile Queue_ ?
      * Provide Priority for different operations – this could be accomplished with an API parameter 


    * Open for discussion on revisiting AAL-Profile-Queue use cases and scenarios.



  * Feedback from Ericsson –


  * AAL-profile-Queue is not _needed_ for configuration of AAL-profile-instance or configuration of AAL-profile-queue(s) on AAL-profile-instance. __
  * For user plane transport, each sendBuffer would be associated with an AAL-Profile-Queue on the AAL-Profile-Instance.
  * AAL-Profile-Queue(s) are a property of the AAL-Profile-Instance (not the AAL-LPU).


  * This way the application can send/receive data from the AAL-Profile-Instance selectively using queues, e.g. set up as CP vs UP or different QoS levels. 
  * It also allows chaining AAL-Profile-Instances together (though that is FFS).


  * The cardinality diagram should be revised in GA&P document as follows:



![](https://firebot-prod-media.s3.amazonaws.com:443/email-attachments/b2121f75-4d21-455f-8c2e-7c9c46673e6a/image003.png)

  * Feedback from NVIDIA– 


    * Async mode of Operation is not needed for inline high-PHY profile, but can be useful for other AAL profiles
    * For inline high-PHY (with entire L1 processing offloaded to Accelerator), Application (L2) does not need a callback, since applications doesn’t do anything knowing the status of the sendBuffer execution. If it fails, the resulting retransmission is triggered by higher layer, not by L2 autonomously



    * Response from Ericsson:


      * Callback could be used when supporting **NR-U** with inline High-PHY – as an indication of channel idle / LBT failure. (faster feedback than HARQ or RLC).



    * Question from Qualcomm to Ericsson’s comment:


      * Wouldn’t the LBT failure notification be an autonomous message from the Accelerator to the application



Lopamudra Kundu, Ph.D.

Senior Standards Engineer

NVIDIA Corporation

Santa Clara, CA

_._,_._,_

* * *

Links:

issue.title: RE: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 2] Clarification of buffer freeing operation after buffer retention
issue.body:
*Sent by Lopa Kundu (lkundu@nvidia.com). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
Dear all,

I would like to summarize the outcome of this email thread discussion so far and see whether we can reach to a consensus and close this FFS item.

Please see the information below and indicate your preference for going forward. I am aiming to close this topic during next AAL call (10/03).

Tagging those who have expressed their views so far, but anyone is welcome to provide their comment/feedback-

[@Timothy Carey (Consultant)](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com), [ @niall.power@intel.com](mailto:niall.power@intel.com), [ @Makarand G Kulkarni](mailto:makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com), [@Jerin Jacob Kollanukkaran](mailto:jerinj@marvell.com)/[@Anh Thu Vo](mailto:avo@marvell.com)

Best Regards,

Lopa

===================================

**_Current Status:_**

So far, majority has preferred Option 2 - 

_Option 2_ \- Application “frees” the buffer back to the pool. 

  * In this case, Application _must not_ invoke freeBuffer until it retrieves the status of sendBufffer operation from AAL Implementation (to ensure buffer is not freed when it is still in use). 
  * This pre-condition would MANDATE callback for Async Operation which otherwise may not be necessary for all AAL profiles (e.g. AAL inline high-PHY)



**_Proposal for making progress_** :

From NVIDIA’s perspective, we _would not want the callback preregistration to be mandated_ for Async operation, because it is simply not necessary for inline highPHY profile.

So, our intention is to streamline the buffer free process – make the behavior of freeing buffer _the same_ for both the cases of 1) Application retaining buffer is _sendBuffer_ and 2) Application releasing buffer in _sendBuffer_

For 2) the behavior is that AAL implementation, upon completion of sendBuffer execution, frees the buffer back to the pool.

For 1) with a streamlined approach, the behavior would be that, when freeBuffer is invoked by Application, the buffer is freed back to the pool “upon” completion of sendBuffer execution by AAL implementation. 

There could be a third option, “Option 3”, which is a modified version of Option 1 (proposed earlier, that no one liked :) )

==============================

Option 3 – AAL implementation frees the buffer

  * freeBuffer Operation description in the spec. is modified to – “ _The freeBuffer operation shall free the buffer back to the buffer pool to which the buffer was allocated from_ , upon completion of sendBuffer or receiveBuffer Operation execution”



===============================

Proposal

Would Option 3 be agreeable to Option 2 proponents?

  * If yes, we will go with Option 3 and accordingly, I can provide a CR to modify freeBuffer Operation description.
  * If no, NVIDIA will compromise and go with Option 2.



Best Regards,

Lopa

**From:** Lopa Kundu   
**Sent:** Monday, September 12, 2022 8:18 AM  
**To:** o-ran-archive@fire.fundersclub.com  
**Subject:** FW: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 2] Clarification of buffer freeing operation after buffer retention

**From:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org) <[WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)> **On Behalf Of** Lopa Kundu (Nvidia) via groups.o-ran.org  
**Sent:** Thursday, September 8, 2022 9:02 AM  
**To:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org); Niall Power <[niall.power@intel.com](mailto:niall.power@intel.com)>  
**Cc:** Kulkarni, Makarand  <[makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com](mailto:makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com)>  
**Subject:** Re: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 2] Clarification of buffer freeing operation after buffer retention

**External email: Use caution opening links or attachments**  
  
---  
  
Hi Niall,

Addressing your questions inline below. Sorry for the long response.

Best Regards,

Lopa

_What happens if the application calls “release” on the buffers while the AAL implementation is still processing send operation ?_ __

  * _Who should free the buffer in this case ?_ __



>> __ [LK] AAL implementation shall free the buffer. When Application invokes releaseBuffer, the underlying API function (implementation dependent) ‘indicates’ the AAL implementation that it can free the buffer when it is done. 

Case 1: Application invokes releaseBuffer when AAL implementation is still processing send operation à Buffer will be freed by AAL implementation when the processing is complete

Case 2: Application invokes releaseBuffer when AAL implementation is done processing send operation à Buffer can be immediately freed by AAL implementation. 

  * In case 2, AAL implementation will not free the buffer if it is dome processing send operation but Application hasn’t invoked releaseBuffer yet.



  * _The send API has already been invoked with buffer_release flag so does the “release” operation change the behaviour of an already executed API ?_ __



>> [LK] buffer_release flag indicates whether Application would like to release the buffer ownership immediately (buffer_release flag ==1) or, would like to retain the buffer ownership beyond send operation (buffer_release flag ==0)

This is how the flow will look like in my view:

**Scenario 1** : buffer ownership is _NOT retained_ by Application

  * Step 1: Application invokes sendBuffer (buffer_release_flag = 1, …) > Buffer is _released_ , i.e. buffer ownership is _transferred_ from Application to AAL implementation with this invocation.
  * Step 2: AAL implementation processes sendBuffer operation.
  * Step 3: When the processing is done, AAL implementation-


    * Returns the status of sendBuffer operation execution in sync mode, or in async mode with a preregistered callback; otherwise AAL implementation does not return a status.
    * AAL implementation ‘frees’ the buffer back to the pool.



NOTE: in this case, there is no ‘freeBuffer’ or ‘releaseBuffer’ invocation by Application.

**Scenario 2** : buffer ownership is _retained_ by Application

  * Step 1: Application invokes sendBuffer (buffer_release_flag = 0, …) > Buffer is _NOT released_ , i.e. buffer ownership is _retained, i.e. NOT transferred_ from Application to AAL implementation with this invocation.
  * Step 2: AAL implementation processes sendBuffer operation.
  * Step 3a: Application invokes releaseBuffer when it wants to transfer the buffer ownership to AAL implementation
  * Step 3b: When the processing is done, AAL implementation-


    * Returns the status of sendBuffer Operation execution in sync mode, or in async mode with a preregistered callback; otherwise AAL implementation does not return a status.
    * AAL implementation ‘frees’ the buffer back to the pool if Step 3a has happened, otherwise it holds onto the buffer until Step3a is invoked, before ‘freeing’ the buffer back to the pool.



NOTE: Step 3a can occur ‘asynchronously’ with step 3b, i.e. Application is _not bound to_ wait until AAL implementation is done processing sendBuffer Operation, before invoking releaseBuffer. In this case, Application invokes releaseBuffer (as proposed by Option 1 below), NOT freeBuffer. 

_In both scenarios 1 & 2 above, it is AAL implementation which ultimately frees the buffer back to the pool._

__

Does the release operation default to a free operation if the buffer is not in a “locked” state. Or does the application still need to call “free” ? 

>> [LK] In case of send operation, Application will not free the buffer. Buffer will always be freed ultimately by the AAL implementation.

Application will release the buffer, i.e. transfer buffer ownership to AAL implementation.

There are two ways of doing it:  
  
1\. Immediately, with sendBuffer invocation : by setting buffer_release_flag = 1. In this case, Application does not need to call releaseBuffer subsequently.

2\. After sendBuffer invocation: by setting buffer_release_flag =0 and later, invoking releaseBuffer.

As explained before, AAL implementation will ultimately free the buffer. 

Regardless Option 1 would also require API’s to check the “state” of buffers whether they were “locked” or “released” state. 

>> [LK] From Application’s POV, since it is not freeing the buffer, merely transferring the ownership to AAL implementation through releaseBuffer, I don’t think checking of the buffer state is necessary from Application’s POV. 

But yes, there could be one use case where Application may want to know the buffer state (‘locked’ or ‘released’) – if the Application retains the buffer and then want to change its content (buffer recycling). In that case, Application needs to know buffer state before changing its content. We haven’t mentioned any clause explicitly for ‘buffer recycling’ use case I believe, and based on our past discussion the conclusion was a well written Application SW will take care of this without guidance from Spec. 

But you’re referring to a ‘mechanism’ for Application to know buffer state which may be useful for the Application to enable buffer recycling use case – so let’s discuss this further.

**From:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org) <[WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)> **On Behalf Of** Tim Carey via groups.o-ran.org  
**Sent:** Thursday, September 8, 2022 6:07 AM  
**To:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org); Niall Power <[niall.power@intel.com](mailto:niall.power@intel.com)>  
**Cc:** Kulkarni, Makarand  <[makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com](mailto:makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com)>  
**Subject:** Re: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 2] Clarification of buffer freeing operation after buffer retention

**External email: Use caution opening links or attachments**  
  
---  
  
_QCM Option 2 – We said that the option on sendBuffer was a convenience option with the same behavior of freeBuffer but automatically performed once the AALI is through with the sendBuffer operation. Just saves the application from sending the freeBuffer_

**From:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org) <[WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)> **On Behalf Of** Jerin Jacob Kollanukkaran  
**Sent:** Thursday, September 8, 2022 5:32 AM  
**To:** Niall Power  <[niall.power@intel.com](mailto:niall.power@intel.com)>; [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)  
**Cc:** Kulkarni, Makarand  <[makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com](mailto:makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com)>; Timothy Carey (Consultant) <[tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com)>  
**Subject:** Re: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 2] Clarification of buffer freeing operation after buffer retention

**WARNING:** This email originated from outside of Qualcomm. Please be wary of any links or attachments, and do not enable macros.

Option 2 for marvell too. 

* * *

**From:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org) <[WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)> on behalf of Niall Power <[niall.power@intel.com](mailto:niall.power@intel.com)>  
**Sent:** Thursday, September 8, 2022 5:58 PM  
**To:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org) <[WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)>  
**Cc:** Kulkarni, Makarand  <[makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com](mailto:makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com)>; Timothy Carey (Consultant) <[tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com)>  
**Subject:** [EXT] Re: [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 2] Clarification of buffer freeing operation after buffer retention

External Email

* * *

Hi Lopa, 

For Option 1 I think there needs to be more details on the exact behaviour especially for corner cases, it’s still not clear to me. 

What happens if the application calls “release” on the buffers while the AAL implementation is still processing send operation ? 

  * Who should free the buffer in this case ? 
  * The send API has already been invoked with buffer_release flag so does the “release” operation change the behaviour of an already executed API ?



Does the release operation default to a free operation if the buffer is not in a “locked” state. Or does the application still need to call “free” ? 

It might have been better to have an symmetric API’s like “lock” and “release” buffers rather than a parameter in the send API. 

Regardless Option 1 would also require API’s to check the “state” of buffers whether they were “locked” or “released” state. 

Option 2 is much simpler to understand (at least to me) and my preference. 

Thanks,

Niall 

**From:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org) <[WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)> **On Behalf Of** Lopa Kundu (Nvidia) via groups.o-ran.org  
**Sent:** Wednesday, September 7, 2022 5:14 AM  
**To:** [WG6@groups.o-ran.org](mailto:WG6@groups.o-ran.org)  
**Cc:** Kulkarni, Makarand  <[makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com](mailto:makarand.kulkarni@saankhyalabs.com)>; Timothy Carey (Consultant) <[tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com)>  
**Subject:** [O-RAN] [WG6] [AAL Transport - Stage 2] [Email thread # 2] Clarification of buffer freeing operation after buffer retention

Dear all,

This email thread is to trigger discussion on item 1.1.4 (FFS 4) in the [ AAL Common planned items table](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Furldefense.proofpoint.com%2Fv2%2Furl%3Fu%3Dhttps-3A__oranalliance.atlassian.net_wiki_spaces_COWG_pages_2567405746_Nov-2B2022-2BWork-2BItem-2BTracker-23AAL-2DCommon-2DAPI-2DPlanned-2DItems%26d%3DDwMFaQ%26c%3DnKjWec2b6R0mOyPaz7xtfQ%26r%3D1DGob4H4rxz6H8uITozGOCa0s5f4wCNtTa4UUKvcsvI%26m%3DFBm1UmFTxQvCEBqy-0gxT4UkdQTxu-MS6SvrJ7Kd93nshSoJgDe4UZY2IWjFoMaH%26s%3DH5gD4ZAaBOZjVozlrI8KWC3L0VIoPHIsgKuqnSv7xiw%26e%3D&data=05%7C01%7Clkundu%40nvidia.com%7C52e8ed0edbfd4f24b76b08da91b3825d%7C43083d15727340c1b7db39efd9ccc17a%7C0%7C0%7C637982497437068178%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=MX7RtSKx46Fzrbe1D2DCw9KMRrS2c0I1DjainTR%2B42k%3D&reserved=0) from O-RAN wiki.

_Topic_ : clarification of buffer release procedure when Application retains buffer ownership in sendBuffer invocation

In case where Application retained buffer ownership in sendBuffer, the following options were discussed before:

  * _Option 1_ \- Application “releases” the buffer instead of “freeing” the buffer. 


    * It is up to AAL implementation to free the buffer back to the pool.
    * In this case a new function releaseBuffer is to be introduced.


      * Upon invocation of releaseBuffer , buffer ownership is transferred from Application to AAL implementation. 


  * _Option 2_ \- Application “frees” the buffer back to the pool. 


    * In this case, Application _must not_ invoke freeBuffer until it retrieves the status of sendBufffer operation from AAL Implementation (to ensure buffer is not freed when it is still in use). 
    * This pre-condition would MANDATE callback for Async Operation which otherwise may not be necessary for all AAL profiles (e.g. AAL inline high-PHY)



As per the discussion during informal AAL F2F meeting on 9/6, following are the feedback (as captured in meeting notes) from Qualcomm and Saankhya Lab:

Qualcomm: Option 1 (Transfer the buffer to implementation so the implementation/owner can decide what to do. App releases buffer, AAL adds back to the pool).

Saankhya Lab: Option 2

NVIDIA: Option 1

Please indicate your preference and additional comments (if any) in this thread.

[@Timothy Carey (Consultant)](mailto:tcarey@qti.qualcomm.com): Please review above and ensure I have captured your preferences correctly. The meeting minutes seemed to capture contradictory views about QC’s preference.

Best Regards,

Lopa

Lopamudra Kundu, Ph.D.

Senior Standards Engineer

NVIDIA Corporation

Santa Clara, CA

_._,_._,_

* * *

**To:** Markert, Joanne (WaTech)  <[joanne.markert@watech.wa.gov](mailto:joanne.markert@watech.wa.gov)>; Kellum, Christina (ECY) <[chei461@ECY.WA.GOV](mailto:chei461@ECY.WA.GOV)>  
**Cc:** Chinn, Keisha  <[chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:chinnk@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Alton, Jesse <[AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:AltonJe@wsdot.wa.gov)>  
**Subject:** RE: CARAs mapping

As I recall, the CARA GIS data sets are/were stewarded by our Environmental Services Office (under Keisha Chinn’s technical support). I recall that it was GIS data built by the ESO staff (about 20 years ago) under a contract funded by DOH. Some counties had specific areas identified and others basically adopted the whole county based on some option defined in the Growth Management Act. I remember talking about retiring the data as being out of date, but the NEPA/SEPA and water quality folks wanted us to keep them since there didn’t seem to be anything better. We didn’t put it on Open Data since it was/is so old and technically, DOH is the data owner.

Long story –>> Keisha can say if they still have / distribute the data AND check with Health. 

~ELL

**From:** Markert, Joanne (WaTech)  <[joanne.markert@watech.wa.gov](mailto:joanne.markert@watech.wa.gov)>   
**Sent:** Wednesday, September 28, 2022 1:23 PM  
**To:** Lanzer, Elizabeth  <[LanzerE@wsdot.wa.gov](mailto:LanzerE@wsdot.wa.gov)>; Kellum, Christina (ECY) <[chei461@ECY.WA.GOV](mailto:chei461@ECY.WA.GOV)>  
**Subject:** FW: CARAs mapping

Hi there,

We are looking for Critical Aquifer Recharge areas data. There is a twisty email thread below, but they are trying to find out who might have this data.

There was some mention that WSDOT used to do this (I do seem to remember that, but am I making that up?). When I google it, it looks like Ecology would have the data, but it doesn’t appear to be on geo.wa.gov.

Could this be a good dataset for GeoPortal 2.0?

If you have any information about this, please let me know and I can help point people in the right direction. If I can help with the data sharing, I’m all about that.

Thanks for your help,

**Joanne Markert**  
State GIS Coordinator  
OCIO/ Strategy & Management

Office: 360-407-8691 | Cell: 360-522-2643  
[Joanne.Markert@watech.wa.gov](mailto:Joanne.Markert@watech.wa.gov) | watech.wa.gov

Do you know who we should be contacting at DOT in their GIS group? Do they have a GIS group? 

Any info you might have would be greatly appreciated! 

Thanks in advance,

Jessica Czajkowski

Assistant State Geologist/Assistant Director of Science and Research

360.902.1117 (office)

**Subject:** RE: CARAs mapping

Good morning! I’m still working on our contracting process…more to come but I’ll get us scheduled for a quick check in next week, in case this contract breaks loose and moves.

I was digging around in some of our guidance documents this morning and came across text from a 2005 white paper on source water assessments: 

As CARA data is incorporated into a local GIS, the WSDOT has been assembling CARA data from around Washington into a statewide GIS.

Does anyone have a connection at WSDOT in their GIS group? I’m so curious if this was built and if it was, has it been updated?? If we don’t have any WSDOT leads, I can reach out to their general mailbox but thought I’d try to see if we know someone first. 

Thanks!

**Nikki Guillot, CPH** ********

issue.body:
*Sent by Adrian Liu (adrian@cnnetwork.org). Created by [fire](https://fire.fundersclub.com/).*

---
(If you are NOT CEO, please kindly forward this to your CEO, because this is urgent. If you believe this has been sent to you in error, please ignore it. Thanks)

Dear CEO,

We are the domain name registration service company in China. On September 27, 2022, we received an application from Hongfeng Ltd requested "geoera" as their internet keyword and China (CN) domain names (geoera.cn, geoera.com.cn, geoera.net.cn, geoera.org.cn). But after checking it, we find this name conflict with your company name or trademark. In order to deal with this matter better, it's necessary to send email to you and confirm whether this company is your distributor or business partner in China?

Best Regards

**Adrian Liu** | Service  & Operations Manager

**China Registry (Head Office)**

![](https://live.staticflickr.com/65535/51955100052_4b903503aa_o.png)

Tel: +86-2161918696

Fax: +86-2161918697

Mob: +86-13816428671

6012, Xingdi Building, No. 1698 Yishan Road, Shanghai 201103, China

*****************************************

This email contains privileged and confidential information intended for the addressee only. If you are not the intended recipient, please destroy this email and inform the sender immediately. We appreciate you respecting the confidentiality of this information by not disclosing or using the information in this email.
